snippet: South Sudan’s military on Friday retook Bentiu, the capital of an oil-producing state, from rebels loyal to the former vice president, according to a military spokesman.
abstract: Military forces of South Sudan's Pres Salva Kiir retake Bentiu, capital of an oil-producing state, from rebels loyal to the former vice president Riek Machar.
lead_paragraph: South Sudan’s military on Friday retook Bentiu, the capital of an oil-producing state, from rebels loyal to the former vice president, according to a military spokesman.

headline.main: South Sudan: Army Says Its Soldiers Have Regained Control of Northern City
headline.print_headline: South Sudan: Army Says Its Soldiers Have Regained Control of Northern City
